tool.name: eukulele
tool.description: a Python program for taxonomic annotation of microbes,in particular eukaryote, in metatranscriptomic and metagenomic samples
tool.command:
mkdir -p "output_dir" && mkdir -p "input_dir" &&
#for $file in $input: ln -s '$file' 'input_dir/$file.element_identifier' && #end for
## add a link to each file of the DB ## we assume, that in the DB only those 3 file types exist
ln -s '${reference_dir.fields.path}'/*.faa db.fasta && ln -s '${reference_dir.fields.path}'/*.txt taxonomy.txt && ln -s '${reference_dir.fields.path}'/*.json prot-map.json &&
## run the tool EUKulele -s 'input_dir' -o 'output_dir' -m '$mets_or_mags'
## link individual DB parts to the command line ## we assume those files artaxonomy.txte alwayscalled like the in the DB folder
--ref_fasta db.fasta --tax_table taxonomy.txt --protein_map prot-map.json
## we always take this extension --n_ext '.faa'
#if $alignment --alignment_choice $alignment #end if
#if $consensus_cutoff --consensus_cutoff $consensus_cutoff #end if #if $cutoff_file --cutoff_file "$cutoff_file" #end if
#if $run_transdecoder --run_transdecoder "$run_transdecoder" #end if
--no_busco

param.label: A choice of aligner to use, currently BLAST or DIAMOND. Default is DIAMOND.
The file extension for samples in nucleotide format. Defaults to .fasta.

param.name: run_transdecoder
param.label: Use TransDecoder to translate input nucleotide sequences
Probability threshold for the first stage.
param.help: The value to be used to decide whether enough of the taxonomic matches are identical to overlook a discrepancy in classification based on hits associated with a contig. Defaults to 0.75 (75%).

param.label: Custom cutoff file for taxonomic classifications (YAML format)
param.help: Provide a YAML file with custom percent identity cutoffs for various taxonomic classifications. If not provided, the default values will be used. #### Example YAML file format: species: 95 genus: 80 family: 65 order: 50 class: 30 division: 20 supergroup: 15 domain: 5 ```

param.label: Run BUSCO assessment in individual mode (default is summary mode)
List of organisms/groups to test the BUSCO completeness of matching contigs for (comma-separated)
Taxonomic level of the groupings indicated in the list of organisms (comma-separated)

tool.help:
What it does ============ EUKulele is a Python program designed for the taxonomic annotation of microbes in metatranscriptomic and metagenomic samples, focusing particularly on eukaryote discovery.
How it works ============ In principle, there are two prerequisites for running the software:
Metagenomic or metatranscriptomic sample files (unless using the provided sample data) A database to align the contigs from the metagenome/metatranscriptome to
Additional Resources ==================== For a more comprehensive understanding of EUKlele and detailed usage instructions, please visit the EUKlele GitHub repository: EUKlele GitHub Repository: [https://github.com/AlexanderLabWHOI/EUKulele]
